title: Unexpected panic when compiling rustdoc

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
`./x.py build` crash after rebase https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/commit/eaadb8947b850a025404082f6297766c4680a42a. ### Code Generally, what I do is: ```bash git pull upstream master git checkout my-branch git rebase master ./x.py build ``` ### Meta `rustc --version --verbose`: ``` rustc 1.65.0-nightly (9c20b2a8c 2022-08-17) binary: rustc commit-hash: 9c20b2a8cc7588decb6de25ac6a7912dcef24d65 commit-date: 2022-08-17 host: x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu release: 1.65.0-nightly LLVM version: 15.0.0 ``` ### Error output ``` ```
Backtrace

Finished release [optimized + debuginfo] target(s) in 0.18s Copying stage0 std from stage0 (x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu -> x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu / x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu) Building stage0 compiler
